title: Ticket #6998: Fix integer overflow bug in MyString::substr()
description: MyString::substr() doesn't have a single-argument form, or a way to provide a second argument that says "until the end of the string," nor does there appear to be a method for the same. Negative lengths explicitly return empty strings (so npos doesn't work). Trying INT_MAX and expecting MyString to truncate appropriately also didn't work because the 'is the supplied length too long' check overflowed.
